body:
Few Tips and resources for startups/ founders to stay efficient in WFH. 

1. Common Google meet link for collab work In case any of the team members is drained out, they can join the link and work. 

2. Trello boards to stay aware of who is doing what.

Dealing with rejection 👊

Running a startup comes with a *lot* of rejection.

Here are 5 tips on how to deal with them, and even make them work for you 👇🧵

I have a pretty decent GPA, study in Pakistan's best business school, am part of a startup, have worked in multiple societies as the director and still i feel like I'm not doing enough as others are and I'll be left behind. Does anyone have any tips for this 😩

💡 Startup tip

Sit on new ideas for 24 hours. If it still feels like good idea, do it.
@FounderEric Thanks for taking a look at it Eric! Prestavi was featured on Betalist today. As a community building expert in the startup space, got any tips for me?

Any startups out there that use Discord instead of Slack for team communication? Any tips on making it work?

I hate Slack as it is designed to be an attention suck and ruins focus, and our community is already on Discord so its one less app to check.

How can a startup founder make herself heard when they have no followers, no community and no customers? 

Here's a 🧵of practical tips from our discussion with amazing  @basakbuilds 
👇

“I have crossed that phase in my life where I have to get my hands dirty”

Pro tip for candidates: If you believe that, don’t apply to a startup.

*Unique Startup Knowledge*

More than 80% of the FB ad campaigns fail.

I have profitably spent over $150mn on Facebook across many startups.

Here are 8 INSIDER TIPS on how you can scale your startup from 0 to 7 figure revenues/month using FB advertising 🚀

Here is what I learned from my 2 failed startups.

Moving quickly and constant learning while not regretting bad decisions are some pro tips to follow while building a startup.

Thread 🧵

Any tips for a 14 team league? Never played before and got into a startup w some 🦈😂😂.  @JonHelmkamp @KidFlashFF @BallBlastEm @stephiesmallls @TheFantasyPT @MattOkada @TKingMode @NimblewNumbers @RumboyzR @RealDealFantasy @dynasty_jake @DynastyNerds @RotoLounge

** FOUNDER TIP** 

Most people who have only worked for government or corporations are not employable. You don’t need the vanity logo in your deck. Just pass.

Folks are going to @ me about the exceptions to the rule. They are just that, exceptions.

Startups need grit & scrappy.

That's all guys

Tip: 
Make your bio about them

Explanation: 
Most bios are all like "I'm Brian and I founded 3800 startups and blah blah..." NOOOOO. Do this instead: "Dog enthusiast & serial entrepreneur. Follow me and I'll give you a free startup idea."

Who does this well? 
@alexgarcia_atx

90% of new startups fail.

I'm making my first investor deck for @earnestcapital's Fund 3 raise (focus on family offices)—and realizing this process is even more secretive than startup funding!

What do I need to include in the deck?
Where can I find solid tips?
Who's willing to share a sample?

🙏🏽

Hey @RealSexyCyborg trying to help out a Nigerian founder whose startup is helping Nigerian importers with their Chinese suppliers. Any tips on partners for money transfer appreciated - that's his current stumbling block. DMs open.
thx, longtime fan

No, I don't want to subscribe to your newsletter to be kept informed of exciting product updates, allow notifications from your website, have tips shown on startup, or rate your app. I'd say thanks for asking, but I'd prefer you didn't even ask.

Tomorrow I have my MD thesis defence and I'm also giving a startup pitch at Startup Fair 'Recharge 2021' contest. Used @canva for the thesis, @prezi for the pitch. Any tips to keep in mind and rock both presentations?
